intro: Habranthus bagnoldii, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme drought conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss. Habranthus bagnoldii is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
